channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Verge not cut this year, 24th September
item.description:
This is the pavement from Greenacre Way to the D bus stop opposite Valentine Road in Bishop's Cleeve. It has not been strimmed etc this year since January 2024. We were told that all verges were to be cut twice a year minimum. Running behind it is a culvert from the balancing pond at the other side of the Greenacre Way junction. Completely overgrown with weeds and rubbish. The pavement needs spraying as the weeds have broken the tarmac. The pavement is now so narrow that two people cannot pass and further down towards the entrance to the old orchard, it is impossible to walk on the pavement. Please sort ASAP. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole (10cm or more) on B4063, 24th September
item.description:
B4063 close to Arle Court roundabout, just west of Briarfields Caravan Park. The pothole is very deep, on the left side of the road. It is almost certainly causing buckled wheels and broken suspension - cars crash into it hard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley

item.title: Drain blocked with foliage, 24th September
item.description:
The drain in the road outside no 78 is blocked by foliage and needs clearing to make it flow as it should. It has been like this for months but the recent heavy rain has really highlighted it.

item.title: Deep flood for 4 days. Impassable for pedestrians and small cars, 24th September
item.description:
The flooded area runs from Woodlands to the end of the cul-de-sac. About 75 metres distance and about 0.6 metres deep. No noticeable drop in level for 3 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shutter Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Drain overflowing, grill sticking up flooding road, 24th September
item.description:
The drain and culvert outside 17 Harveyâ€™s Lane Winchcombe is blocked. The water has lifted the grill. The culvert from Langley Hill constantly flows under the drains. You claim that the job has been dealt with and have closed the notification you can clearly see from the photos take a few minutes ago that this is NOT the case. Please sort the problem OR report it to the appropriate authorities for them to fix it. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harvey's Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian lights changing continuously when there is no one there, 24th September
item.description:
Pedestrian lights in P E Way near the end of Grevil road are changing continuously even when no one is there. It appears as if the button has been wedged in. The traffic is backing up around the Tewkesbury road roundabout so even when the lights are green you cannot enter. It is backing up in all directions and getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Drains blocked, 24th September
item.description:
Drains in the area of Selkirk Close and Selkirk Gardens not cleared and are blocked with debris. Elizabeth Organ <elizabethorgan@gmail.com> Sun, 22 Sept, 15:38 (2 days ago) to cleansing Dear Sirs I would be grateful if you would be able to clear a blocked drain outside my house. In previous years I have always used my leaf blower to suck out loose leaves and debris however. I am now disabled and unable to do so. My address is: Harcourt Selkirk Gardens Cheltenham GL52 5LY Tel: 07814 80 66 61 I am sure you have many requests like this but after the storm on friday, for the 1st time in the 27 years I have lived here, the road outside was flooded together with water up to both front and rear entrance steps. Luckily I had visitors who were able to lift manhole covers although as the rain water was gushing in from the road it was rather a thankless task. I would be most grateful if the drains in the road could be cleared. Many thanks Kind regards E. Organ
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Selkirk Gardens, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
